verses.text: Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in the broad places thereof, if ye can find a man, if there be \add any\add* that executeth judgment, that seeketh the truth; and I will pardon it.
And though they say, The \sc Lord\sc* liveth; surely they swear falsely.

O \sc Lord\sc*, \add are\add* not thine eyes upon the truth? thou hast stricken them, but they have not grieved; thou hast consumed them, \add but\add* they have refused to receive correction: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.
Therefore I said, Surely these \add are\add* poor; they are foolish: for they know not the way of the \sc Lord\sc*, \add nor\add* the judgment of their God.

I will get me unto the great men, and will speak unto them; for they have known the way of the \sc Lord\sc*, \add and\add* the judgment of their God: but these have altogether broken the yoke, \add and\add* burst the bonds.

Wherefore a lion out of the forest shall slay them, \add and\add* a wolf of the evenings shall spoil them, a leopard shall watch over their cities: every one that goeth out thence shall be torn in pieces: because their transgressions are many, \add and\add* their backslidings are increased.

How shall I pardon thee for this? thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by \add them that are\add* no gods: when I had fed them to the full, they then committed adultery, and assembled themselves by troops \add in\add* the harlots’ houses.
They were \add as\add* fed horses in the morning: every one neighed after his neighbour’s wife.
Shall I not visit for these \add things?\add* saith the \sc Lord\sc*: and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
Go ye up upon her walls, and destroy; but make not a full end: take away her battlements; for they \add are\add* not the \sc Lord’s\sc*.
For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
They have belied the \sc Lord\sc*, and said, \add It is\add* not he; neither shall evil come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine:
and the prophets shall become wind, and the word \add is\add* not in them: thus shall it be done unto them.
Wherefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* God of hosts, Because ye speak this word, behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire, and this people wood, and it shall devour them.

Lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far, O house of Israel, saith the \sc Lord\sc*: it \add is\add* a mighty nation, it \add is\add* an ancient nation, a nation whose language thou knowest not, neither understandest what they say.
Their quiver \add is\add* as an open sepulchre, they \add are\add* all mighty \add men\add*.

And they shall eat up thine harvest, and thy bread, \add which\add* thy sons and thy daughters should eat: they shall eat up thy flocks and thine herds: they shall eat up thy vines and thy fig trees: they shall impoverish thy fenced cities, wherein thou trustedst, with the sword.
Nevertheless in those days, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, I will not make a full end with you.

And it shall come to pass, when ye shall say, Wherefore doth the \sc Lord\sc* our God all these \add things\add* unto us? then shalt thou answer them, Like as ye have forsaken me, and served strange gods in your land, so shall ye serve strangers in a land \add that is\add* not yours.
Declare this in the house of Jacob, and publish it in Judah, saying,
Hear now this, O foolish people, and without understanding; which have eyes, and see not; which have ears, and hear not:

fear ye not me? saith the \sc Lord\sc*: will ye not tremble at my presence, which have placed the sand \add for\add* the bound of the sea \add by\add* a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass it: and though the waves thereof toss themselves, yet can they not prevail; though they roar, yet can they not pass over it?
But this people hath a revolting and a rebellious heart; they are revolted and gone.
Neither say they in their heart, Let us now fear the \sc Lord\sc* our God, that giveth rain, both the former and the latter, in his season: he reserveth unto us the appointed weeks of the harvest.
Your iniquities have turned away these \add things\add*, and your sins have withholden good \add things\add* from you.
For among my people are found wicked \add men:\add* they lay wait, as he that setteth snares; they set a trap, they catch men.
As a cage \add is\add* full \add of\add* birds, so \add are\add* their houses full \add of\add* deceit: therefore they are become great, and waxen rich.
They are waxen fat, they shine: yea, they overpass the deeds of the wicked: they judge not the cause, the cause of the fatherless, yet they prosper; and the right of the needy do they not judge.
Shall I not visit for these \add things?\add* saith the \sc Lord\sc*: shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
A wonderful and horrible thing is committed in the land;
the prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love \add to have it\add* so: and what will ye do in the end thereof?
